_meta.name: withamplifier-content
_meta.description: Complete source mapping for withamplifier.com content generation and validation

accuracy_types.verbatim: Must exactly match source files - commands, URLs, technical terms, code snippets
accuracy_types.synthesized: Describes documented capabilities in own words - must be factually accurate but not word-for-word
accuracy_types.marketing: Creative copy that captures spirit of project - should align with source concepts but allows creative liberty

_meta.regeneration_notes: This outline maps all data-section elements from withamplifier.com to source files. Each section has an accuracy_type that determines validation approach.

content_sections.prompt: Based on the README's description of Amplifier, write a compelling headline (5-8 words) that captures the core value proposition. Current website uses 'Build AI Your Way With Amplifier'. This is marketing copy so creative liberty is allowed, but it should accurately reflect what Amplifier is about - ownership, customization, transparency.

rules.description: Must accurately represent what Amplifier does

content_sections.current_website_value: Build AI Your Way With Amplifier

sources.contribution: Core philosophy of ownership and transparency
Bundles as plain text files concept

content_sections.prompt: Write a 1-2 sentence subtitle that emphasizes: (1) Your AI agent is a file you can read/write/share, (2) It's not a black box you rent, (3) It's a tool you own. Check source docs to verify these claims are accurate.

rules.description: Claims about ownership and file-based config must be verifiable in docs

content_sections.current_website_value: Your AI agent is a file you can read, write, and share. Not a black box you rent. A tool you own.

content_sections.prompt: Extract the primary installation command for Amplifier CLI exactly as it appears in the README. This should be a 'uv tool install' command pointing to the GitHub repository. Output ONLY the command string, nothing else. Do not modify or 'improve' it.

rules.description: Command must exactly match what's in README.md
The GitHub URL in the command must be accessible

content_sections.prompt: Write a short punchy headline (3-5 words) that captures Amplifier's transparency philosophy. Current site uses 'No black boxes. Ever.' Verify this aligns with the documented design philosophy.

rules.description: Must align with documented transparency principles

sources.contribution: Design principles around inspection and control

content_sections.prompt: Write 1-2 sentences explaining that most AI tools hide how they work, but Amplifier shows you everything - you can inspect any component, swap any piece, own the whole stack. Verify these claims against the documentation.

rules.description: Claims about inspection and swapping must be documented capabilities

content_sections.current_website_value: Most AI tools hide how they work. Amplifier shows you everything. Inspect any component, swap any piece, own the whole stack.

content_sections.prompt:
Write content for the 'Use any model' feature card:
- title: 'Use any model'
- description: Explain that the model/provider is a swappable component - you can switch providers without rewriting anything, tools and workflows just work.

Verify this claim by checking MODULES.md for multiple providers and PROVIDER_CONTRACT.md for the abstraction layer.

rules.description: Provider swapping capability must be documented

current_website_value.title: Use any model
current_website_value.description: The model is a component, not a cage. Switch providers without rewriting anything. Your tools and workflows just work.

content_sections.prompt:
Write content for the 'See everything' feature card:
- title: 'See everything'
- description: Explain that you can watch it think - every decision is logged, every tool call is visible. When something breaks, you know exactly where and why.

CRITICAL: Verify this claim is accurate by checking:
1. HOOKS_API.md for observability hooks
2. KERNEL_PHILOSOPHY.md for event-first observability
3. Any logging/debugging documentation

If 'every decision logged' is overstated, adjust the claim to match reality.

rules.description: Logging/observability claims must match actual capabilities
Do not overstate what is actually logged or visible

current_website_value.title: See everything
current_website_value.description: Watch it think. Every decision logged, every tool call visible. When something breaks, you know exactly where and why.

web_element.element: Terminal/code example showing amplifier in action

content_sections.prompt:
Generate a realistic terminal example showing Amplifier in action. Should demonstrate:
1. Running an amplifier command
2. Showing provider info
3. Showing tool usage
4. Showing meaningful output

The example should be representative but doesn't need to be a real transcript. Commands like 'amplifier run' and 'amplifier provider use' should match actual CLI syntax from docs.

Output should be realistic even if not verbatim

content_sections.current_website_value: A bundle is your entire setup in plain text. The providers you trust, the tools you need, the behaviors you've refined. As you work, you adapt it. As you share it, others adapt theirs. The more you use it, the more it becomes yours.

content_sections.prompt:
Extract the list of community-contributed bundles, apps, and modules from MODULES.md for the ecosystem carousel. For each item, include:
- name: Display name
- description: Short description
- author: GitHub username/org
- github_url: Full GitHub URL
- category: 'bundle', 'app', 'module', or 'provider'
- status: 'validated', 'popular', 'experimental', or 'community'

CRITICAL RULES:
1. ONLY include items that are ACTUALLY LISTED in MODULES.md
2. Do NOT invent bundles or use placeholder names
3. Do NOT include fictional authors like '@amplifier-labs', '@apicraft', '@dataflow' unless they exist in MODULES.md
4. All github_url values must be real, accessible URLs
5. If MODULES.md has fewer items than the current website shows, that's correct - only show real items

rules.description: All GitHub URLs must return HTTP 200
Every item must be in MODULES.md
Do not invent items not in source
